thread.title: Tracy Morgan and George Lopez join the lineup for Eddie Murphy's Mark Twain Prize ceremony - Showbiz
thread.title_full: Tracy Morgan and George Lopez join the lineup for Eddie Murphy's Mark Twain Prize ceremony - Showbiz News - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: Tracy Morgan and George Lopez join the lineup for Eddie Murphy's Mark Twain Prize ceremony - Showbiz
text: Tracy Morgan and George Lopez are the latest names to join the all-star lineup for Eddie Murphy's Mark Twain Prize ceremony.Murphy's contribution to American comedy will be celebrated at the Kennedy Center in Washington DC on October 18. © Getty Images / Steve Mack Morgan and Lopez will be on the bill alongside Alabama Shakes musician Brittany Howard.Previously-announced performers include SNL veterans Jay Pharoah, Chris Rock and Kevin Nealon, as well as Daily Show host Trevor Noah, Whitney Cummings, Dave Chappelle and Kathy Griffin.Murphy's old Saturday Night Live cohort Joe Piscopo will also be making a special appearance during the gala.The 54-year-old comedian is a Golden Globe and Screen Actors Guild Award winner for Dreamgirls, who has also earned four Primetime Emmy Award nominations. © NBC Universal Murphy's selection for the Mark Twain Prize means that he will follow in the footsteps of previous winners Richard Pryor, Whoopi Goldberg, Tina Fey, Ellen DeGeneres and Jay Leno.Highlights from the 2015 Mark Twain Prize ceremony airs on November 23 on PBS.
